description.narrative: Established in 2012, Building Evidence in Education (BE2) is an international working group of education research funders composed of about 35 member organisations including bilateral donors, foundations, multilaterals, UN organizations and their associated institutes, and two international networks: the Interagency Network for Education in Emergencies and the Youth Employment Funders Group. The Secretariat of BE2 ensures continuous coordination within donor agencies to enhance standards in evidence creation and usage in the education sector. Mannion Daniels is delivering the function of a secretariat (the Secretariat) for the work of the Building Evidence in Education (BE2).

The overall objective of the Secretariat is to contribute to improved education outcomes from the research and evidence generated and disseminated by BE2 and its members. The Secretariat aims to support the continuous coordination of donor agencies and to enhance standards in evidence creation and usage in the education sector The Secretariat will also support the objectives of the Global Education Evidence Advisory Panel (GEEAP).
